config-root.name: config-root
config-root.description: your config folder containing your config files and optional schema.json

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: print stack traces in case of errors

args.name: config_file
args.description: path to a decrypted config file, for example: `strong-config decrypt config/production.yml`

args.name: output_path
args.description: output file of the decrypted config. If not specified, the file found at CONFIG_FILE is overwritten in-place.

config-root.name: config-root
config-root.description: your config folder containing your config files and optional schema.json

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: print stack traces in case of errors

key-provider.name: key-provider
key-provider.description: key provider to use to encrypt secrets

key-id.name: key-id
key-id.description: reference to a unique key managed by the key provider

encrypted-key-suffix.name: encrypted-key-suffix
encrypted-key-suffix.description: key suffix determining the values to be encrypted

unencrypted-key-suffix.name: unencrypted-key-suffix
unencrypted-key-suffix.description: key suffix determining the values to be NOT encrypted

args.name: config_file
args.description: path to an unencrypted config file, for example: `strong-config encrypt config/production.yml`

args.name: output_path
args.description: output file of the encrypted config. If not specified, the file found at CONFIG_FILE is overwritten in-place.

generate-types.description: generate typescript types based on schema.json

config-root.name: config-root
config-root.description: your config folder containing your schema.json

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: print stack traces in case of errors

validate.description: validate config files against a schema

config-root.name: config-root
config-root.description: your config folder containing your config files and optional schema.json

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.description: print stack traces in case of errors

args.name: config_file
args.description: path to an unencrypted config file, for example `strong-config validate config/production.yml`
